intro: Arabis blepharophylla, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock mustard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustard. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves that are often lobed or toothed. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. The species is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
